catalogue_raissonne: Fragment from Bartsch 30, vol. 8, p. 308, Nagler Monogrammisten III, no. 43
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: column at center with putti (one sitting, one reclining) holding a horn on each side; putto at L cuddles small animal; garland stretches across top and hangs down sides
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram and date in plate at base of column: [IB / 1529]
title: Two Genii Sitting at the Base of a Column (section from The Forge of the Heart)
